meanings.definition: Feeling pleased or honored by praise or attention.
meanings.sent1: She felt flattered by the kind words of her friend.
meanings.sent2: The actress was flattered by the compliments on her performance.
meanings.sent3: He was so flattered by the attention that he blushed.
meanings.sent4: The flowers in the garden looked flattered by the sunlight's touch.
meanings.sent5: The puppy's tail wagged happily, as if flattered by the affection.

meanings.sent1: The salesperson tried to flatter the customer into buying more.
meanings.sent2: She didn't appreciate being flattered just to get a favor.
meanings.sent3: His attempt to flatter his boss with compliments backfired.
meanings.sent4: The politician's speech was filled with empty flattery to flatter the audience.
meanings.sent5: The cat purred, hoping to flatter its way into extra treats.

meanings.definition: To make someone feel pleased or honored by praise or attention.
meanings.sent1: The teacher's kind words never failed to flatter her students.
meanings.sent2: He knew how to flatter his girlfriend with thoughtful gestures.
meanings.sent3: The chef tried to flatter the food critic with a special dessert.
meanings.sent4: The artist's work was designed to flatter the viewers' senses.
meanings.sent5: The singer's performance was meant to flatter the audience's ears.
